channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: Microsoft Will Preload Windows 11 File Explorer to Fix Bad Performance
item.description:
UI showing the Task View in Xbox full screen experience on PC. For more information about the Xbox full screen experience, visit Full screen experience expands to more Windows 11 PC form factors. Feedback: Share your thoughts in Feedback Hub (WIN + F) under Gaming and Xbox > Gaming Full Screen Experience.

HN Discussion

Read Original Article

Top 7 Comments:

skavi:

IIRC they started preloading Office application recently as well.

calebj0seph:

The File Explorer in Windows has so much tech debt behind it.

It's quite obvious to see which parts are still Win32 and which are XAML. The two different context menus are a well-known example, but one that really annoys me is the Home view vs. the This PC view.

If you make Explorer open with the This PC view by default, you get a blinding flash of white every time you create a new tab in dark mode. That doesn't happen with the Home view which has been updated to XAML.

It's one of the many things you experience day to day that really makes me disappointed in the level of quality in modern Windows.

BobbyTables2:

Wait a minute, they’re preloading “explorer.exe” ???

Performance wasn’t an issue 20 years ago. Now it is ???

That takes effort!

frankacter:

First this is a very editorialized title, the original is:

"Announcing Windows 11 Insider Preview Build 26220.7271 (Dev & Beta Channels)"

Secondly, they're preloading the executable resident in memory to accelerate click to open, similar to what Chrome Browser does on Windows (and websites when browsing)

I don't perceive this as "fixing bad performance, given explorer has never been slow to open for me, but rather further optimizing the experience.

Ygg2:

Didn't all Windows from 95 onwards preload explorer?

tomrod:

Windows 11 is so bad. It's worse than Vista. Microsoft took everything decent about Windows after the Windows 8 debacle and decided if it works it needs to break.

It's unfortunate. Microsoft had the talent to have premier products but is stuck in second or third on everything.

Appropriate, if funny: https://ritholtz.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/2011.06.27_o...

themafia:

Microsoft Will Preload Windows 11 File Explorer to Hide the Impacts of Bad Performance.

item.title: Arduino Terms of Service and Privacy Policy update: setting the record straight
item.description:
Minors’ data and privacy. Our privacy disclosures have been strengthened, including enhanced protections for minors’ data. Here’s what the updates actually cover: Enhanced transparency around data practices: We’ve made our privacy disclosures more precise and more detailed, including what data we retain, to protect your privacy.

HN Discussion

Read Original Article

Top 3 Comments:

riazrizvi:

This allays my concerns. I appreciate the response to this community’s concerns.

12_throw_away:

"We are Arduino. We are open. We’re not going anywhere."

-- statement from Qualcomm without a single human being's name on it

PaulHoule:

Sorry, you got bought by Qualcomm and that was suicide.

item.title: LAPD helicopter tracker with real-time operating costs
The death of tech idealism and rise of the homeless in Northern California
item.description:
When I drove over after arriving in Cupertino, however, a camp lined the main road into town; hundreds of unhoused residents inhabited another area along the river. When thirty approached, I began to think of things like owning a home, which even an hour from the Valley’s gravitational center was out of reach with my income at the time. I’d been away from California for twelve years.

HN Discussion

Read Original Article

Top 2 Comments:

hrbsoscbfo:

Didn’t make it past the first sentence.

Gimpei:

I don’t understand who commissions and who reads pieces like this. Here is a person with no expertise in housing policy, no expertise in homelessness, and no expertise in tech. The only thing he’s bringing to the table is an opinion, which, as the saying goes, are like assholes. Blame inequality and tech and libertarians all you want, but it won’t do a damn thing to solve the homelessness crisis, which is fundamentally a housing supply issue. But I suppose that doesn’t lend itself to the kind of uninformed moralizing that apparently brings such delight to the hearts of lithub readers.

item.title: Sharper MRI scans may be on horizon thanks to new physics-based model
